columns.name: name
columns.description: The name of the patch baseline.

columns.name: baseline_id
columns.description: The ID of the retrieved patch baseline.

columns.name: description
columns.description: A description of the patch baseline.

columns.name: operating_system
columns.description: Returns the operating system specified for the patch baseline.

columns.name: created_date
columns.description: The date the patch baseline was created.

columns.name: modified_date
columns.description: The date the patch baseline was last modified.

columns.name: approved_patches_compliance_level
columns.description: Returns the specified compliance severity level for approved patches in the patch baseline.

columns.name: approved_patches_enable_non_security
columns.description: Indicates whether the list of approved patches includes non-security updates that should be applied to the instances. The default value is 'false'. Applies to Linux instances only.

columns.name: approval_rules
columns.description: A set of rules used to include patches in the baseline.

columns.name: approved_patches
columns.description: A list of explicitly approved patches for the baseline.

columns.name: global_filters
columns.description: A set of global filters used to exclude patches from the baseline.

columns.name: patch_groups
columns.description: Patch groups included in the patch baseline.

columns.name: rejected_patches_action
columns.description: The action specified to take on patches included in the RejectedPatches list. A patch can be allowed only if it is a dependency of another package, or blocked entirely along with packages that include it as a dependency.

columns.name: rejected_patches
columns.description: A list of explicitly rejected patches for the baseline.

columns.name: sources
columns.description: Information about the patches to use to update the instances, including target operating systems and source repositories. Applies to Linux instances only.

columns.name: tags_src
columns.description: A list of tags assigned to the patch baseline.
